intro: Oreopanax iotrichus, commonly known as the hairy oreopanax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with a hairy texture, which gives it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Oreopanax iotrichus is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
